chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J Knebel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 2 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Comply with sex offender registration.
Comply with sex offender treatment.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females.
Not to have any employment or be involved in any community service organization that involves any unsupervised contact with minor females.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victim (C. S.) or her family listed in the Criminal Complaint.  ONLY exception is for theraputic reasons and ONLY upon the request of the victim.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 120 DAYS - to be served STRAIGHT TIME, FORTHWITH.
Next 4 months are to be served with non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.  In lieu of employment, defendant is retired.  Release for treatment, counseling and community service.
Last 4 months are STAYED - to be used at the discretion of the agent.
Court will allow for transfer to Winnabago County.

records.addlTxt:
Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Peter J Knebel in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  10 Years.
Initial Confinement:  4 Years.
Extended Supervision:  6 Years.
2 Days Credit.
STAYED.    

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is  eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  10 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Winnabago County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Comply with sex offender registration.
Comply with sex offender treatment.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females.
Not to have any employment or be involved in any community service organization that involves any unsupervised contact with minor females.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the agent.
No contact with:  victim (C.S.) or her family listed in the criminal complaint - ONLY Except is for theraputic reasons and ONLY upon request of the victim.
DNA sample to be provided.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply bail and refund balance to the posting party.

CONDITION TIME:
1 Year in the Waukesha County Jail.
120 Days to be served Straight-Time - FORTHWITH.
Next 4 Months to be served with huber (all standard release conditions, In Lieu of employment - he is Retired, release for treatment, counseling and community service).
Last 4 Months - STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.
Court will allow for transfer to Winnabago County.
